summary: This document contains preparation notes for Juan Alessi's trial testimony, detailing his review of a photo book and his recollections about Jeffrey Epstein's household operations, Ghislaine Maxwell's role, and specific observations about the Palm Beach residence. It appears to be a summary of statements made to prosecutors in preparation for trial.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein being prepared for trial testimony. He is shown a photo book and provides recollections about the household, Epstein, and Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE. Alessi identifies him in a photo and provides details about his employment, travel, and household routines.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as GM. Alessi identifies her in a photo and recounts her instructions to him, her managerial role over Epstein's properties, and observations of nude photographs of her.

persons.name: Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a property location (New Albany) that Maxwell managed for Epstein.

persons.name: AUSA Det. Attorney Reynolds
persons.context: Attorney preparing Juan Alessi for trial testimony, as indicated in the document header.

connections.description: Alessi was an employee in Epstein's Palm Beach residence, responsible for household tasks including assisting with masseuses.
Maxwell was Alessi's supervisor, giving him instructions not to engage with Epstein or look him in the eye, and directing travel logistics.
Maxwell is described as the 'boss' of Epstein's homes and was involved in directing the pickup of females from the airport.
Maxwell managed a property for Epstein located in New Albany, where Wexner was.

events.title: Trial Testimony Preparation
events.description: Juan Alessi is prepared for trial testimony by AUSA Det. Attorney Reynolds. He reviews a photo book and provides detailed recollections.

keyFacts: Juan Alessi identified Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in a photo book during trial preparation.
Ghislaine Maxwell told Alessi she was the 'boss' of Epstein's homes in NY, Paris, NM, New Albany, and the private island.
Maxwell instructed Alessi not to engage in conversation with Epstein and not to look him in the eye during his final year of employment.
Alessi recalls that either Maxwell or Epstein's NY secretary would direct him to pick up females from the airport.
Alessi observed a nude photograph of Maxwell in her bathroom and another in the pool house, and noted that penis vibrators were kept in a basket in Maxwell's bathroom.
